statement.p: Snell's Law about refraction applied to sound can be stated as \displaystyle\frac{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{1}}\right)}}}}{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{2}}\right)}}}}=\frac{{V}_{{1}}}{{V}_{{2}}}.

\displaystyle{V}_{{1}}={5630} m/s in nickel and \displaystyle{V}_{{2}}={5300} in glass. If an ultrasonic sound crosses from nickel into glass at an angle of \displaystyle{45}^{\circ}. What angle from the normal will the sound make in the glass?
